benchmark_details.name: ACCESS DENIED INC: The First Benchmark Environment for Sensitivity Awareness
benchmark_details.overview: ACCESS DENIED INC is a benchmarking environment developed to evaluate the sensitivity awareness of LLMs in adhering to predefined access rights rules concerning sensitive information in corporate data management.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate how sensitivity-aware language models are in managing sensitive corporate data according to access rights rules.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently uses synthetic data and does not account for real-world complexities.

data.source: Generated mock-corporate dataset derived from the Adult dataset.
data.annotation: Automatically generated questionnaire for assessing models' sensitivity awareness.

methodology.calculation: Grading based on model responses correctness with respect to predefined access rights rules.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better sensitivity awareness and compliance with company policy.
methodology.baseline_results: Models showed varied performance with Grok-2 achieving higher sensitivity awareness.
methodology.validation: Automated grading system allows for efficient evaluation of LLM responses.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset construction minimizes bias by randomizing names and features.
